thread.section_title: The Chase contestants branded absolute thieves after three shocking low offers – Metro
thread.title: The Chase contestants branded absolute thieves after three shocking low offers
thread.title_full: The Chase contestants branded absolute thieves after three shocking low offers

author: Rebecca Lewis
title: The Chase contestants branded absolute thieves after three shocking low offers
text:
Thieves (Picture: ITV) Monday night’s episode of The Chase may go down in history as fans of the game show took to Twitter to name and shame the three ‘thieves’ that decided to go for low or minus offers.
More: Uncategorised Theresa May to trigger Brexit next Wednesday 
Sponsored Things that secretly make you really happy 
Unforgettable images of polar bears without ice 
Georgia, Carole, and Michael were all taking part in the ITV quiz show along with Darragh, but after Darragh went for an impressive £9000, Michael went for the low offer of £300, Carole chose -£1000 and then Georgia bottled it and went for -£2000 to gasps around the studio and in living rooms up and down the country.
‘Start a go fund me page for darragh. Absolute thieves,’ wrote one fan on Twitter while others compared the scenes to Crimewatch.
Going for a minus offer does not endear you to viewers (Picture: ITV) The whole point of the ITV quiz show is for a team of four contestants to individually attempt to amass as much money as possible, which is later added to a prize fund if the contestant survives their individual chase.
Although an individual can decide to go for a low or minus offer, which will provide them with an easy question and the chance to guarantee a prize fund to go home with, the decision to go low can lead to bitterness from other team members and complete anarchy from viewers at home.
#TheChase i really hope those 3 thieves are on twitter right now & feel the burning sense of shame they should. Well done Darragh 
— vikki✌ (@viksterp) March 20, 2017 
Omg I would have drop kicked each one of them sneaky snakes. Absolutely shocking!! #TheChase 
— heather turner (@heatherstweets1) March 20, 2017 
THREE MINUS OFFERS! #TheChase pic.twitter.com/b4utoWr5TG 
— Matt Bentley (@JustMattBentley) March 20, 2017 
Darragh – the man, the myth, the hero, the look of pure hatred #TheChase pic.twitter.com/tvFbjqCiXT 
— Sam Elliott (@S_J_Elliott) March 20, 2017 
Start a go fund me page for darragh. Absolute thieves #thechase 
— Jack Parris (@chintuft) March 20, 2017 
Live scenes of darragh being hugged by his teammates #TheChase pic.twitter.com/7PLNKjbvW8 
— Liam Worsnop (@LiamWorsnop) March 20, 2017 
More: Uncategorised Antonio Conte sends warning to Player of the Year candidate N'Golo Kante 
Tennis-obsessed father found not guilty of bullying his daughters to stardom 
Nine lucky people will get to dive underwater to see the Titanic up close 
That episode of #TheChase will be repeated on BBC1 as #Crimewatch .
— David Mateer (@d_mateer) March 20, 2017 

Perhaps it’s time for a rule change?
People taking minus should be penalised if they end up winning by getting a extremely lower % than the other players who didn't #TheChase 
— Bill (@RocknRollSucide) March 20, 2017 

The moment is only the fourth time in The Chase history that three players have gone low and got through to the final.
They ended up with £6,300 (£1575 each) before going in to the final chase with a full house of team members.
